DataElement.preferredName: New Neoplasm Event Pharmacotherapy Month Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the month of the pharmaceutical treatment for the new tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Event; something that happens at a given place and time._Treatment of disease through the use of drugs.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:Event; something that happens at a given place and time.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
Something that happens at a given place and time.

Property.preferredDefinition: Treatment of disease through the use of drugs.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of disease through the use of drugs.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Uveal Melanoma form per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 8/29/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Event; something that happens at a given place and time._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of ten equal parts; a quantity corresponding to one tenth of the whole.: A list or register of events; a tabular array of the days.: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

Concepts.definition: One of ten equal parts; a quantity corresponding to one tenth of the whole.
A list or register of events; a tabular array of the days.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
